adjectives.description: vinegary (comparative more vinegary, superlative most vinegary)

examples: When Martha reopened the bottle of wine from the previous week's party, a vinegary whiff indicated that drinking it was out of the question.
Edward's maiden aunt was a vinegary old soul with a sharp tongue and quick temper; she would not be receiving a wedding invitation.

entries.meaning: Of a liquid, having turned partially or fully to vinegar.
